channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: The whole end of Priors Road is a disgrace it’s now dangerous, 4th March
item.description:
Whole road is torn up, you have to swerve and avoid oncoming traffic. The previous poor repairs have gone. Either it’s poor work by contractors or not being checked. Council Officer in charge needs to be held to account.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Priors Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

On the roundabout

item.title: Large pothole causing water to accumulate near bus stop, 4th March
item.description:
Large expanse of water gathering in large pothole directly in in front of bus stop causing splashing of pedestrians and those waiting for buses.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ermin Way, Birdlip, Cotswold

item.title: Metal Cover in Road, Nosiy, 4th March
item.description:
Metal cover towards end of close, becoming noisy when driven over by larger vehicles, causing disturbance
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cousley Close, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic Light Sequencing Issues, 4th March
item.description:
Since the resurfacing works have been undertaken there are issues with: Lights in Carisbrook Rd not letting cars go, missing a sequence on 1-2 light change cycles, leading to cars backing up on Carisbrooke Rd and into Billbrook Rd. Lights on Hucclecote Rd and junction with Churchdown Lane/Carslisbrooke Rd, travelling towards Delta Way from Barnwood, only letting 3-4 cars pass but traffic light on other direction towards Barnwood is on green for a lot longer. Took me 15 minutes to travel from Wagon & Horses to Green Lane today.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Carisbrooke Road, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Streetlight permanently out - street too dark to be safe, 4th March
item.description:
Elmfield Raod
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13a, Elmfield Road, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Temporary Traffic Lights with no information board, 4th March
item.description:
Temporary lights on Station Road, Churchdown due to Wales and West Utility work have no contact information for reporting outages. The lights are already causing considerable tailbacks due to the proximity to the 4 schools within the area. Contractors onsite claim that they are unable to adjust the timing to prevent queues backing on to Pirton Lane.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Information board identifying emergency contact company/number not displayed

item.title: Street light is permanently out problem, 4th March
item.description:
All Street Lights out, terrible lighting without them and the footway and carriageway are so uneven.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 4th March
item.description:
Carriageway is worn out, and hasn't been looked at for at least 20 year. This road has a large volume with both vehicular and foot traffic.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole, 4th March
item.description:
Large pothole outside 90 Elmleaze Multiple holes, some were filled recently others left and now this one has trebled in size. Debris all along the road. The Thomas riches school buses crashing over and shaking the houses.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmleaze, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Collection of pot holes in the road, 4th March
item.description:
East bound up to the turn of Morley Avenue large collection of pot holes with no chance of avoiding unless you encrouch onto oncoming trafic, been present for several months if not longer since we moved into the area
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pirton Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 4th March
item.description:
20/02/24 email rcvd, passed from Cheltenham BC - Hi Many years ago a tree was removed from the footpath edge outside 19 Copt Elm Road. Over the years I be seen Tree staff visit, including last year when a planting team arrived, but could not do anything as the stump remains in the ground. I wonder when we will get a new tree, just as has been planted outside 15 Copt Elm Road. Have you an update please? Thanks
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 4th March
item.description:
email rec 22/02/2024 - As you can see a lot of holes have been filled but the heavy good vehicles will always be reopening up these holes, as they have to stay to the left hand side of the road due to parked cars opposite - see attached
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Daft Road Signage, 4th March
item.description:
Traffic on the A40 or A436 heading towards Oxford meet a road sign diverting them on to the closed (fro maintenance) section of the A40. As a consequence 50% ignore the road closure, and the other 50% come into the little village of Shipton Oliffe (with its small roads, pothole problems, tiny bridges and fords). When I tried to explian the problem to a Highways man in a truck, he swore at me.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A436, Shipton, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: Dumped / abandoned roadworks signs, 4th March
item.description:
Pavement outside 61 Queens Road GL50 2NF Pair of roadworks signs seemingly dumped / abandoned. Been there a couple of weeks for no apparent reason. Need removing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 63, Queen's Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
